intro: Freycinetia ponapensis, commonly known as the Pohnpei lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Pohnpei in the Federated States of Micronesia. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences composed of numerous white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and have a smooth texture, while its roots are fibrous and well-developed. Freycinetia ponapensis is of cultural and ecological significance to the local communities of Pohnpei.
